p: We recorded 2,154 nesting events from a minimum of 366 individual hawksbills, representing 72.8% of total nests recorded in the eastern Pacific during 2010–2015 and 69.3% of total mature females identified in the entire eastern Pacific region (Gaos et al., 2017). Of these nests, 877 (40.7%) were located at Bahía de Jiquilisco (2011–2015) and 1,277 (59.3%) at Estero Padre Ramos (2010–2015). Most hawksbills nested between May and August at Bahía de Jiquilisco (96.4%, n = 845 clutches) and Estero Padre Ramos (96.3%, n = 1,230 clutches), with a peak in nesting occurring in June and July (Bahía de Jiquilisco, 69.9%, n = 613 clutches; Estero Padre Ramos, 68.1%, n = 869 clutches; Figure 3a,b).
